text: Blessed by the Ruinous Powers this warrior transforms into a fearsome beast.
At one with the frozen plains and snowy tundra, wherever this one goes, they bring the icy heart of the North with them.
This Packlord has drawn the attention of the gods with his hunts, earning the chance to receive their favour.
Alfkaell, Bloodfather of the Aeslings, wields Khorne's fury, his visage draped in bearskin, eyes of sapphire, and a staff named "Nithi" adorned with victims' bones
Alfkael rides into battle in his wolf-drawn chariot, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.
Haunting whispers surround Alfkaell, cursing his enemies and sowing seeds of despair in their hearts
In the crimson haze of slaughter, Alfkaell discerns the hidden truths of battle, guiding his every strike.
The fallen chant in the shadows, their whispers fueling Alfkaell's relentless advance.
he hunt calls to Alfkaell, guiding him unerringly to his prey with primal precision.
Even in the face of insurmountable odds, Alfkaell stands unyielding, his resolve an unbreakable shield.
Alfkaell bears the mark of the Khagan, a symbol of his status as a chosen vessel of Khorne's wrath.
Ancient runes writhe with power, amplifying Alfkaell's fury and unleashing devastation upon his foes.
Norsemen revel in the hunt nearly as much as they do in battle. Where will this band head?
A gathering of tents, bones, and hides, thick with the smell of blood and meat.
A formidable gathering of veteran hunters in search of the next great quarry.
Although savage, the Packlords are the undisputed master hunters of the frigid north.
Some beasts are near-untameable, but at least you can pen them up until you have use for them.
Mutating energies of Chaos constantly infect the many wolf species of Norsca, producing all manner of lupine abominations.
The wolves of the north gather to answer their Packlord's call.
It is right to honor the divine wolf. Does he hear when his hunters howl?
The southerners call him "Ulric." Ha! Our God is far more brutal than their watered-down pup.
A proper shrine has been built, hung with the trophies of our hunts. The Hunter will grant us his favor.
Give me the fangs of the Wolf, give me the claws of the Wolf, give me the coat of the Wolf; I will show your enemies the mercy of the Wolf.
Several hunters are posted around the camp's perimeter, keeping eyes and ears peeled for danger.
The hunting hounds can serve just as well as watchdogs.
Hunting snares, pitfall traps...there are so many ways to thwart a would-be infiltrator.
It is folly to try and sneak up on a camp of Skin Wolves. To do so is to ask for an alarm howl to bring the entire pack down on your head.
Bands of hunters set out, tracking prey through forest and fen.
Experienced Norsemen can hunt greater and more dangerous quarries, bringing in a steady supply of meat and skins.
Few can rival these hunters. Fewer can evade them.
Do you feel it? That quickening of your pulse?
Come! Run! Join the pack as we run down our prey!
Sets up a hunting camp, allowing for building construction, recruitment and replenishment, regardless of territory.
A band of wandering hunters, searching for even greater prey.
Sentries, watchdogs, and a stout fence about the perimeter keep this camp safe.
A Packlord's hunting camp is as much a beast den as it is a campsite.
The best hunters know to honor the gods.
Armed with spear, tooth, and claw, these hunters bring down man and beast.
Skin Wolf Packlords are the strongest among their twisted kin. They wield tooth and claw with savage ferocity, commanding others of their ilk.
Skin Wolf Packlords are the strongest among their twisted kin. They wield tooth and claw with savage ferocity, commanding others of their ilk.
The strongest and most powerful of the Skin Wolves, this champion has been named "Packlord."
The strongest and most powerful of the Skin Wolves, this champion has been named "Packlord."
The strongest and most powerful of the Skin Wolves, this champion has been named "Packlord."
The strongest and most powerful of the Skin Wolves, this champion has been named "Packlord."
The strongest and most powerful of the Skin Wolves, this champion has been named "Packlord."
The strongest and most powerful of the Skin Wolves, this champion has been named "Packlord."
The Wolf Chieftain commands Wolf and Skinwolf into battle and they obey every command.
Gained by defeating a Dwarf lord in battle
Gained by defeating a Cathayan legendary lord in battle
Gained by defeating any Bloodthirster, Great Unclean One, Keeper of Secrets, Lord of Change, or Daemon Prince in battle
Gained by defeating an army containing a Kharibdyss or any kind of Leviathans or Prometheans (includes mounts) in battle
Gained by defeating an army containing Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Hawk Riders, or Wood Elf Warbeasts in battle
Gained by defeating an army containing Snow Leopards, or any kind of Mammoth or Bear (includes mounts) in battle
Gained by defeating an army containing any kind of Dragon Ogre, Chaos Spawn, Minotaur, or Chaos Giant in battle
Gained by defeating an army containing Feral Wyverns, Stone or River trolls, or any kind of Arachnarok spider (includes mounts) in battle
Gained by defeating an army containing any kind of animated constructs in battle
Gained by defeating an army containing stonehorns (includes mounts) in battle
Gained by defeating an army containing Tier IV or higher melee cavalry from Bretonnia, Kislev, or the Empire in battle
Gained by defeating an army containing any giant dinosaur-like creatures (includes mounts) in battle
Gained by defeating an army containing Rat Ogres, Brood Horrors, or Hell Pit Abominations (includes mounts) in battle
Gained by defeating an army containing any kind of dragons (includes mounts) in battle
Gained by defeating a vampire lord in battle
Gained by defeating a Tomb Kings lord in battle
Gained by defeating a lord from Bretonnia, Kislev, or the Empire in battle
Gained by defeating a High Elf lord in battle
Gained by defeating a Wood Elf or Treeman lord in battle
Gained by defeating a Dark Elf lord in battle
Driven by primal instinct and a voracious appetite, this Skin Wolf is always hunting for its next prey.
Gains unique traits after hunting exotic prey
Khorne is the embodiement of strength and the granter of victories. Blood for the Blood God!
Slaanesh is lord of feasts and celebrations. To accept their gift will assure prosperous hunts and raids.
Nurgle's "blessings" devastate tribe and foe alike. Accepting his favor will allow us to wield his contagions.
Tzeentch is the master of the seers and shamans. His gift will surely grant similar arcane knowledge.
Olric is the master of hunters, the packlord of packlords. Only his favor is worthwhile!
Something about that cry rouses the hunter's spirit, causes the blood to stir...
Accept a gift from the Four
Our hunt has earned us the recognition of the gods. Let us see how they reward us.

We have slain monster, daemon, and champion in our countless hunts, and our achievement has not gone unnoticed. The Four are impressed and wish to reward their rising champion, while in the distance a mighty howl can be heard echoing over the mountains. Whose favor shall we recieve?
We have earned the attention of the Four, but we may only receive a boon from one. Whose gift shall we receive?
Following the wolf cry, we find ourselves in a frigid mountain valley. Before us stands an enormous white wolf, its eyes gleaming with intelligence. Hail to the Wolf God.
Defeat a Dwarf lord in battle.
Defeat a Cathayan legendary lord in battle.
Defeat any Bloodthirster, Great Unclean One, Keeper of Secrets, Lord of Change, or Daemon Prince in battle.
Defeat an army containing a Kharibdyss or any kind of Leviathans or Prometheans in battle.

Defeat an army containing Snow Leopards, or any kind of Mammoth or Ice Bear in battle.
Defeat an army containing any kind of Dragon Ogre, Chaos Spawn, Minotaur, or Chaos Giant in battle.
Defeat an army containing Feral Wyverns, Stone or River trolls, or any kind of Arachnarok spider in battle.
Defeat an army containing any kind of animated constructs in battle.
Defeat an army containing stonehorns in battle.
Defeat an army containing Tier IV or higher melee cavalry from Bretonnia, Kislev, or the Empire in battle.
Defeat an army containing any giant dinosaur-like creatures in battle.
Defeat an army containing Rat Ogres, Brood Horrors, or Hell Pit Abominations in battle.
Defeat an army containing any kind of dragons in battle.

Defeat a lord from Bretonnia, Kislev, or the Empire in battle.
Defeat a High Elf lord in battle.
Defeat a Wood Elf or Treeman lord in battle.
Defeat a Dark Elf lord in battle.
To the Black Lands of Naggaroth
To the Empire of the Dragons
#(character) has completed a challenge.\\n\\nThey have gained the [[b]]"#(initiative_record)"[[/b]]
Skin Wolf or human, the Wolf Chieftain is a dangerous foe.
Skin Wolf or human, the Wolf Chieftain is a dangerous foe.
Skin Wolf or human, the Wolf Chieftain is a dangerous foe.
Skin Wolf or human, the Wolf Chieftain is a dangerous foe.
Skin Wolf or human, the Wolf Chieftain is a dangerous foe.

On a cold and perilous Rúnanótt (or “Geheimnisnacht,” as the southerners call it), a dying thrall fled into the tundra to give birth. Her wails were loud and lonely, but her efforts bore fruit — her babe’s first breath was full of ice, and Huern was welcomed into the world by the distant howling of wolves. How the boy survived is a matter of speculation, as are his origins. Some say his father was a thrall, others a chieftain. Many, however, claim he is the offspring of Olric himself, and that the Winter Wolf carried him to safety that fateful night. Regardless, it is true that the blood of a wolf runs through Huern’s veins. A Skin Wolf since birth, Huern has mastered his feral and savage appetites, channeling the beast’s bloodlust against his foes. His ferocity and prowess have become a local legend, drawing other skin wolves and werekin to his banner. For now, the Tribe of the Wolf rules the Naglfari Plain, hunting across its mountains and tundra. Yet greater prey lives beyond the Tribe’s lands – perhaps it is time to begin the Hunt?

Huern has risen far, but he has not forgotten the treatment which killed his mother and forced him to struggle to live as a child. This keepsake of his dying mother ensures that he will never forget—and will always despise—those with power who abuse it.
Torn from the bloody fingers of the previous ruler of the Naglfari Plain, this horn rallies the spirit of the Tribe of the Wolf and is proof that Huern has earned his place among the lords of Norsca.
Leadership: %+n for all Skin Wolf units
Upkeep: %+n% for Skinwolves, Norscan Ice Wolves and Norscan Warhounds
Vanguard deployment for Norscan Ice Wolves
Summons a pack of Giant Wolves
Attribute: Causes Terror for Skin Wolf units and Skin Wolf transformation
Global recruitment duration: %+n turn(s) for Skin Wolf units (minimum 1)
Recruitment duration: %+n turn(s) for Skin Wolf units (minimum 1)
Armour-piercing weapon damage: %+n for Skin Wolf units
Recruit rank: %+n for Skin Wolf units
Passive ability: "Horrible Regeneration" for Skin Wolf units
Diplomatic relations: %+n with the faction of [[img:UI/Flags/wh_dlc08_nor_wintertooth/mon_24.png]][[/img]]Wintertooth
Skin Wolf Packlords have access to mobile Hunting Camps which provide limited recruitment options and unlock improvements for their army in both campaign and battle.

Recruit Skin Wolf Packlords to lead your armies across the world. Huern and his Packlords have access to unique Hunting Journey targets. Defeat armies with specific enemies to unlock powerful buffs for the lord or their army.
The wolves and Skin Wolves of Norsca gather under the banner of the Black Wolf, drawn by his legend and bound by his strength.
The Skinwolves of Norsca follow only the strongest.
To some the beast is a blessing, to others a curse.
Trained personally by the Wolf Chieftain, these Wolves guard the leaders of the Tribe with their lives.
All Skin Wolves have the ability to regenerate their horrid forms, even as humans.
The beasts within can get further blessings from the Dark Gods. Sharper claws or unbreakable bodies are some of them.
My wolves, rage! My wolves, howl! My wolves, fight!
After battle the mangled gore that remains is devoured by Huern and his ravenous, insatiable Werekin.
Skin Wolves in Huern's service enjoy speed and skill beyond even their preternatural capabilities.
Fast and vicious, the Tribe of the Wolf's hunting packs spread fear and terror, striking where they are needed most.

Although Wulfrik is the better-known bearer of this title, Huern is possessed of a keen curiosity about the wider world. Having secured a land for his tribe, he now sets forth on many journeys to see what there is to discover, hunt, or conquer.
Though they once were drifters and vagrants, the elite warriors of the Tribe of the Wolf have proven themselves to be a disciplined unit to be feared.
Blessed by the Ruinous Powers, this warrior transforms into a fearsome beast.
Trained personally by the Wolf Chieftain, these Wolves guard the leaders of the Tribe with their lives.
When Huern's ushers his Bloow Howl, running is pointless.
Huern's mother - Alruna the White Wolf - died an unjust death, frightened and alone. Her son will not falter.
Back! Once more into the fray!
Alfkael Bloodfather is a figure of legend, a wanderer at home amidst the ice and snow of the northern mountains.
The Bloodfather of the Aeslings, guides them down Khorne's path whilst the tribe worship his staff ''Nithi'' - which is blessed by the Bloodgod himself.

Alfkaell, a sapphire-eyed seer draped in bearskin, was Bloodfather of the Aeslings, guiding them down Khorne's path. His staff, "Nithi," dripped with endless blood, adorned with bones of victims, a grim testament to his devotion. In battles, he stood lean and thin, yet his presence commanded fear, his voice wispy like steam, echoing Khorne's wrath
Alfkael Bloodfather is a figure of legend, a wanderer at home amidst the ice and snow of the northern mountains.
Alfkael Bloodfather is a figure of legend, a wanderer at home amidst the ice and snow of the northern mountains.
Ulsdau's battle-prowess multiplied manifold when he received the blessings of the werekin. Now Frostaxe is a berserker without peer, loyal only to the Wolf Chieftain who bested him.

Once an ordinary, albeit hulking, berserker, Ulsdau's battle-prowess multiplied manifold when he received the blessings of the werekin. Now Frostaxe is a berserker without peer, loyal only to the Wolf Chieftain who bested him.
The sight of Ulsdau, dripping with the gore of his foes, is terrible indeed.
Once, Ulsdau served as a bondsman in service to an Aesling jarl. So great was his stature that many thought him to be a troll.
Ulsdau was the greatest among his tribe’s berserkers, with countless victories and scars accumulated over years of battle.
The bloodlust of a Skin Wolf was not so different from the battle rage of a berserker, and so Ulsdau felt comfortable in his new form, emboldened by its strength and senses.
When Ulsdau was blessed with the power of the werekin, he could no longer serve any master. Slaying his arrogant jarl, Ulsdau fled out into the tundra, seeking stronger foes.

Several years into his wanderings, Ulsdau found a new foe to challenge – a young man black of hair with eyes like the stormy sea. For two days did they duel upon a frozen lake, their blows ringing like thunderclaps.
Bested by Huern in their duel, Ulsdau was nevertheless spared by the Black Wolf. Ever since that day, Ulsdau has sworn eternal loyalty and friendship to the one man worthy of his respect.
Ulsdau is a renowned berserker who once wandered Norsca in search of stronger foes.

Amidst the windswept ruins of Vinnskor, Einarr Sigdansson, the Champion of Tzeentch, uncovers a shard of hope amidst the wreckage of his shattered past. Whispers carry tales of his beloved Asta, once thought lost to the cruel blades of the Aeslings, now rumored to roam the dense forests of Bretonnia. Asta, chieftess of Vinnskor and skilled huntress, was torn from her home and sold into the clutches of a Bretonnian noble, destined to serve as a slave in a foreign court. //n//n Driven by a firestorm of vengeance and longing, Einarr embarks on a perilous journey beyond the storm-tossed seas, his resolve unyielding as he sails towards the sun-kissed shores of Bretonnia. With the promise of Asta's liberation burning brightly in his heart, Einarr sets forth to raid the lands of Bordeleaux, where rumors whisper of her elusive presence. In the heart of enemy territory, amidst the opulent halls of nobility and the twisted alleys of Bretonnian towns, lies the key to unlocking Asta's chains.

Belonging to an older tradition than the mystics who draw their power solely from the Ruinous Powers, Alfkael the Bloodfather is a legendary Vitki of Norsca. “Old One-Eye,” as he is called, wanders the frozen ice sheets and towering peaks, seeking wisdom amidst the wild and tempestuous Winds of Magic and the winter stars. When Alfkael drifts into a Norscan village or tribal hold, all folk – from the greatest king to the humblest thrall – make a space for him by the fire and gather to hear his tales.\\n\\nWe have received word that Old One-Eye is currently on an island in the Northern Sea of Chaos. We should send a messenger to invite him to our lands, for his presence would surely bring fortune in our endeavours!

We should send a messenger to invite him to our lands, for his presence would surely bring fortune in our endeavours!
Sold by Aesling slavers to a Bretonnian Noble, Asta - wife of Einarr Sigdansson - vowed to take her revenge and reunite with her tribe.
Sold by Aesling slavers to a Bretonnian Noble, Asta - wife of Einarr Sigdansson - vowed to take her revenge and reunite with her tribe.
Sold by Aesling slavers to a Bretonnian Noble, Asta - wife of Einarr Sigdansson - vowed to take her revenge and reunite with her tribe.
Sold by Aesling slavers to a Bretonnian Noble, Asta - wife of Einarr Sigdansson - vowed to take her revenge and reunite with her tribe.
Sold by Aesling slavers to a Bretonnian Noble, Asta - wife of Einarr Sigdansson - vowed to take her revenge and reunite with her tribe.
Gjálfr is an enormous ice wolf who once dominated the packs of Norsca. Now, he is Asta's loyal companion on her hunts.
The fiercest of Shieldmaidens of the Baersonling is Asta of Vinnskor, huntress and champion of unparalled skill.
The Chieftess of the Baersonling supports the Jarl not just as her ruler, but as his most loyal, beloved and trusted advisor. An unbreakable bond indeed.
Whether in the forests of Bretonnia or the frigid wastes of the north, traps and preparation have served Asta well in her hunts.
Like her spouse, Asta is blessed by the Great Eagle - the changer of ways. They're loyalty to each other only matched by their loyalty to him.
It is Asta, not Einarr, who manages the day-to-day affairs. Her gift for numbers and logistics have blessed the tribe with prosperity.
Asta concocts a mystical dish that grants potent healing to herself or an ally in battle, restoring them to full vigor with its mysterious properties.
Asta and Einarr's bond is one of devotion, passion, and united purpose. When Asta calls, the Baersonling Berserkers answer without hesitation.
After the sacking of Vinnskor the Aesling sold Asta amongst the other slaves to a Bretonnian Noble, the undespicable torture she had to undergo still fuels her heart with mindless rage.
Hiding in Bretonnian forests after escaping her faith, Asta is capable of finding or creating the tools she needs for her hunts.
Asta of Vinnskor may count her prowess among the shieldmaidens of the old Saga's. A valkyre in name and tale.
Greatest among the wonders she encountered on her hunts near the Frozen Landing was Gjálfr, an ice wolf of incomparable size. Now, woman and wolf are inseparable companions.
Greatest among the wonders she encountered on her hunts near the Frozen Landing was Gjálfr, an ice wolf of incomparable size. Now, woman and wolf are inseparable companions.
Melee defence: %+n when fighting against Bretonnia
Champions of the Tribe of the Wolf rally to the side of their Chieftess.
Attribute: "Immune to Psychology" for Marauder units

[[col:red]]This Regiment of Renown will unlock only if you ally or Confederate Tribe of the Wolf faction or have Huern the Wolf in your faction provided that you have any character with a level of 25 or higher[[/col]]

In the eyes of the Northmen, there is a natural distinction between the mass of roving warriors, and the favoured few. The ultimate ambition of a Marauder is to die fighting under the gaze of the Dark Gods, or otherwise become worthy and powerful enough to travel to the far north to face their judgement directly. Individuals strong enough to walk that path emerge only occasionally: Marauder Champions, who fight and kill with more skill and ferocity than their brethren, and so gain a higher status in their warrior hierarchies. The otherworldly rewards are not always clear, however – these standout fighters epitomise both the glory and the risk of seeking the attention of the Dark Gods, treading along a knife’s edge between immortality and oblivion.

Aspiring Champions are often the best any Chaos Warrior can hope to become, since the unending peril of fighting in a Chaos host means that few progress any higher. Those who achieve champion status will eliminate anyone they see as competition, butchering any promising underlings to ensure their continued station in their God’s hordes. As a result, many form their own warbands until they achieve their goals or meet their end by the blade of a rival. Those on this long and often doomed path are obsessed individuals, only recalling the most pertinent details of their past, and many assume new identities to replace those lost to them.
These champions have sworn a blood-oath to Huern and would follow him into the Realms of Chaos or die before backing down.
These champions have sworn a blood-oath to Huern and would follow him into the Realms of Chaos or die before backing down.
Elite warriors handpicked for their skill and loyalty to defend the chieftess of the Tribe of the Wolf.
All champions strive to be chosen, willing their deeds to be observed and judged. These champions are the heroes of the Tribe of the Wolf.
Ulsdau’s twin axes have served him well over the years, felling man and monster alike. Bathed in the blood of a particularly mighty frost troll, the blades emit the bitter chill of the North.

Forged in the depths of the Ardenwood, Asta's bow, aptly named the Ardenwood Bow, embodies the fusion of Norscan resilience and Bretonnian grace. Crafted from sturdy Ardenwood trees, it bears the marks of Asta's indomitable spirit and her relentless quest for survival. Each arrow unleashed from its string carries the whispers of Asta's determination and the fury of her longing for vengeance. As she draws back the bowstring, she channels the strength of her people and the cunning of her newfound wilderness, striking fear into the hearts of her enemies and hope into the souls of her allies

Nithi, the staff of Alfkaell, is a grim artifact dripping with the blood of countless victims. Crafted from the bones of fallen foes and imbued with Khorne's wrath, it thirsts eternally for battle. Each bone adorning its surface represents a life claimed in the name of the Blood God, empowering Alfkaell with relentless fury. Legends whisper of the staff's insatiable hunger, driving its wielder to ever greater acts of violence in Khorne's name.

When battle is spent, a Skin Wolf’s transformation is reversed and like a newborn the human must tear its way free of the monstrous form. Huern has crafted an armour from this hide, a fearsome thing of cursed leather and black fur.

Deep within the plains of Naglfari lies the secretive domain of Huern the Wolf, powerful chieftain of the Tribe of the Wolf. Here, amidst hundreds of hidden tunnels, the packlords gather under the moon's watchful gaze. The den, a village unto itself, serves as the heart of the Huern bloodline's power, from which they command the fierce werekin to embark on their relentless bloodhunts. It is a realm shrouded in mystery, where the howls of the pack echo through the night, a testament to the dominance of the Wolf Tribe in the wilds of Naglfari.

Deep within the plains of Naglfari lies the secretive domain of Huern the Wolf, powerful chieftain of the Tribe of the Wolf. Here, amidst hundreds of hidden tunnels, the packlords gather under the moon's watchful gaze. The den, a village unto itself, serves as the heart of the Huern bloodline's power, from which they command the fierce werekin to embark on their relentless bloodhunts. It is a realm shrouded in mystery, where the howls of the pack echo through the night, a testament to the dominance of the Wolf Tribe in the wilds of Naglfari.

It is a realm shrouded in mystery, where the howls of the pack echo through the night, a testament to the dominance of the Wolf Tribe in the wilds of Naglfari.
Ulsdau's axes emit such a bitter cold that ice forms about his body like armour. This second-skin of ice both protects his body and harms foes, as weapon blows send sharp fragments flying.
Ulsdau's axes emit such a bitter cold that ice forms about his body like armour. This second-skin of ice both protects his body and harms foes, as weapon blows send sharp fragments flying.
Nithi's bloodied bones cackling against each other sap the will to fight from Alfkael's foes.
Called by the Vitki, this king of Norsca's skies comes to the battlefield.
He is just a boy who cried wolf..

Carved from a branch of an ancient ash tree and containing a core of dragon bone, One-Eye’s staff thrums with the magic-laden winds of the northern mountains. In battle, the old wanderer can call upon these winds to blow aside enemy arrows and sap the will of would-be foes.
The Tribe of the Wolf stalk the Naglfarli plains in search of they're next prey, be it men or beast.
Passive Ability: "Scourge of Naglfari" when in Skin Wolf form
The Black Wolf stalks and hunts his prey in an increasingly effective manner, becoming more deadly with each succesful kill.
The fury of swipes leave deep cuts gushing out blood which only invigorate the frenzied werekin.
Known for his expert tracking capabilities no foe may mask his sent when the Werekin is close.
Ability: "Moonlit Bloodlust" when in Skin Wolf form
Enters a frenzied state of bloodlust where Huerns gains increasing momentum in his horrendous flurry of slashes and violence.

Asta concocts a mystical dish that grants potent healing to herself or an ally in battle, restoring them to full vigor with its mysterious properties.
When not in combat, the soothing aroma and invigorating taste of her concoction heal nearby allies, preparing them for the trials of battle.
